p: In the acute phase status epilepticus, coma, thrombocytopenia, hyponatremia as a result of inappropriate secretion of antidiuretic hormone, and cerebral edema are serious complications. Cerebral edema is the result of direct viral infection, for which enteroviruses are known, or for seizure activity. Both the seizure activity and accompanying hypoxia in untreated convulsive status epilepticus may contribute to the maintenance of a vicious cycle of continued cell damage.
